Will They Be Punished? Men In Gujarat Bullied A Leopard Cub For 'Fun' And Made A Video Of It

Will They Be Punished? Men In Gujarat Bullied A Leopard Cub For 'Fun' And Made A Video Of It

Animal cruelty encompasses of not just killing or sexual assault of animals. Bullying animals and force-feeding them is also an act of animal cruelty. Disturbing animals in their natural habitat and abusing them for fun is becoming increasingly common and the so-called laws against animal cruelty require serious revision for crimes like these to stop.

A video has come forward, reportedly from Gujarat, which shows a bunch of men bullying a leopard cub and it is rapidly going viral, invoking people’s ire.

The video has been shared by a Twitter user Zubin Ashara with the caption, ‘These culprits should be jailed, they are seen here harassing Leopard cub, anyone who can identify them please Dm me or forest department. This video has emerged probably close to Gir'.

These culprits should be jailed, they are seen here harassing Leopard cub, anyone who can identify them please Dm me or forest department. This video has emerged probably close to Gir @dave_janak @ParveenKaswan @susantananda3 @mpparimal pic.twitter.com/o48SliXokW — Zubin Ashara (@zubinashara) October 13, 2019

In the video, one can hear the men enjoying the act of forcefully capturing the cub, which is disgusting and disgraceful, to say the least. They almost seem proud and the man making the video even pans the camera to his face to be a part of the video.

Taking notice of the incident, IFS Parveen Kaswan forwarded the matter to the authorities and tweeted about it too.

It has been forwarded to authorities. — Parveen Kaswan, IFS (@ParveenKaswan) October 14, 2019

The leopard is clearly scared and alert, unaware of what the men might do next. Even though a lot of people in the comments are asking for these men to be punished, the fact of the matter is, there are no strict laws in India that punish offenders for animal abuse, and that is a shame.
